body.p: All page definitions are found in: [PLUGIN_DIR]css/print/p-pages-and-headers.css.
There are page definitions for the default page, chapter page, table of contents page, front matter page, back matter page, index page, large tables page, and blank page.

section.title: Default Page
section.p: The default page imposes a header that contains the publication title, chapter, and section title. They alternate on the left or right side of the page:

section.title: Front Page
section.p: The cover page. It clears the headers.

section.title: Table of Contents Page
section.p: The table of content page. It clears the headers and uses a lower roman page number in the header.

section.title: Chapter Page
section.p: The chapter page is inherited from the default page. The chapter page is associated with the topics marked as chapters, usually direct children of the map. It clears the header from the first page of each chapter. If you need to add other information to the chapter headers, make sure you override these rules in your CSS:

section.title: Front Matter and Back Matter Page
section.p: The bookmap front matter and back matter page. It clears the headers.

section.title: Index Page
section.p: The index page containing the index terms (and appears only if there are such items in your topics). It uses a lower alpha page number in the footer:
When transformed, the page layout is spread on two columns.
